content: flaunt it by stitchnerd designs needle circular in the size you need to get gauge - probably 7mm - closest us size is 10½ length - max 80cm/30 long if the needle cable is not too long you ll get a nice flow as you knit if it s longer you ll have to keep adjusting - blog link for what to do http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/01/tip-too-few-stitches-for- your-circular html yarn miss babs k2 or similar - it s listed as bulky but bulky yarns can vary greatly - if you are substituting be sure to check and use one with a similar yardage - k2 has approx 110m/125yds per 100g i used a single skein of k2 205g = 219m to make a nice deep cowl that gives options for wear stitchnerd miss babs k2 on 7mm you could make a shorter cowl with less yardage single loop the cowl is tapered approx size = 60 cm/24 around x 45cm x 17 tall you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the pattern page on ravelry gauge approx 14st per 10cm/4 in stockinette to swatch you need to cast on at least 20 stitches so that you can measure in the middle section gauge isn t really critical but if your knitting is much tighter you may need to add extra repeats add 14 stitches to the cast-on for each extra repeat tip i recommend you try on your cowl before you start section 4 when you have about ¼ of your yarn left if it s looser than you d like you split the last ¼ into 1/8th and work the extra round of decreases yarn management the pattern recommends using fractions of your yarn for the various sections if you have a set of scales you can weigh your yarn if you like if not just estimate it s not critical that the fractions are exact abbreviations k = knit p = purl ssk = slip 2 stitches separately knitwise and then knit together through the back loops p2tog = purl 2 together © ashcroft-hempsall 2015 - for personal non-commercial use only flaunt it 2 getting started cast on 98 stitches using cable cast-on link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html tip if you find you get a gap when you change from knit to work the first round and then join purl try purling into the back place a marker for the start of the round and be sure not to twist of the first purl stitch as you join you can place a marker for each repeat if you like but once you ve done a couple of rounds you ll probably find you can see the stitches and don t need the markers 1st section use approx ¼ of your yarn round 1 1 *k9 p5 repeat from * 14 sts in each repeat repeat this row until you are ready to decrease 1st decrease round *k9 p2tog p3 repeat from * work once
